thoughts.text: I will use the execute_python_code command to calculate the distance and travel time to the hiking trail I want to visit.
thoughts.reasoning: Before embarking on my hiking adventure, it is important to know how far away the hiking trail is and how long it will take to get there. The execute_python_code command will allow me to calculate the distance and travel time to the hiking trail using the Google Maps API.
thoughts.plan:
- Use the execute_python_code command to calculate the distance and travel time to the hiking trail
- Plan my adventure accordingly, including what time to leave and how long to spend on the trail
thoughts.criticism: I need to make sure that I am accounting for traffic and other potential delays when calculating the travel time to the hiking trail.
thoughts.speak: I will use the execute_python_code command to calculate the distance and travel time to the hiking trail I want to visit.

args.code:
import googlemaps
from datetime import datetime

# Enter your API key here
gmaps = googlemaps.Client(key='YOUR_API_KEY')

# Define the addresses
origin = 'YOUR_ADDRESS'
destination = 'DESTINATION_ADDRESS'

# Define the departure time
now = datetime.now()

# Calculate the distance and travel time
result = gmaps.directions(origin, destination, mode="driving", departure_time=now)
distance = result[0]['legs'][0]['distance']['text']
travel_time = result[0]['legs'][0]['duration']['text']

print("The distance to the hiking trail is:", distance)
print("The travel time to the hiking trail is:", travel_time)
